start.text: 'Ah, a traveler! My forge has been busy all morning. What brings you here?'
start.lore: Holger has been shaping iron and steel for decades. His arms bear the marks of many years at the anvil.

tools_info.text: 'I forge swords, shields, and all manners of tools. With practice, you could apprentice with me.'
tools_info.lore: Holger's hammer is said to strike true, passed down from his father. Sparks dance like fireflies whenever he works.

forge_lore.text: 'The forge was rebuilt after a storm five years ago. Some of the stones still bear scorch marks from that night. I remember it as if it was yesterday...'
forge_lore.lore: Legends say that the old forge could shape metal without fire. Holger likes to tell this story to those who listen, but you can see his posture change whenever he talks about it.

rumors.text: 'Travelers whisper of strange lights in the eastern marsh. Some say spirits move between the reeds at night.'
rumors.lore: Holger prefers to stay in the village, but he sometimes wonders what truths lie beyond the hills.

rumors_more.text: 'Some claim to hear a bell tolling deep in the marsh, but others think it's just the wind through the reeds. But hey, who am I to choose what is right and what is wrong - you might just have to go look for yourself.'
rumors_more.lore: These tales have been told for generations. Holger shares them to entertain curious travelers.

world_lore.text: 'The lands are old, shaped by wars long past. Lynthaven itself was once part of a larger kingdom.'
world_lore.lore: Holger knows much about the local region: the old mines, the river trade routes, and the nearby meadow.

history.text: 'Lynthaven grew around the river. Long ago, knights defended these lands from invaders, but most of their castles are ruins now.'

wildlife.text: 'The forests are home to foxes, wolves, and the occasional bear. The marshes hide creatures most avoid.'

end.text: Farewell, traveler. May your hammer never miss.

start.text: The girl glances at you, but says nothing.

town.text: She shrugs, pointing vaguely toward the blacksmith and the fountain.

start.text: 'Welcome, traveler. I can teach you about health and stamina, and what happens when you fall in battle.'

stamina.text: 'Stamina is your energy for actions. It regenerates slowly over time, so pacing yourself is important. Resting can speed it up.'

death.text: 'When you die, you lose some gold and might drop items. Be careful! But don't worry, death isn't permanent, you can always continue your journey.'

lore.text: 'Lynthaven has stood for generations as a small trading hub. Travelers and craftsmen come here to exchange goods and knowledge.'

start.text: 'Ah, hello there! The waters are calm today. Care to try your hand at fishing?'
start.lore: He’s been fishing these waters for decades. His hands are weathered, but his eyes sparkle with the love for the river.

options.label: Hear a story about the pond

fishing_intro.text: 'Fishing is simple, but patience is key. Catch 5 fish and you’ll learn the basics. Use your basic wooden fishing rod.'
fishing_intro.lore: The old man pats your back and gives a soft smile.

pond_lore.text: 'This pond has been here longer than anyone can remember. Strange lights sometimes appear at night, they say the water spirits dance.'
pond_lore.lore: Old stories tell of travelers who vanished near the pond, though no one knows what truly happened.

end.text: Farewell, traveler. May your hooks always find a bite.
